summary: Expand “Criminal Defence 305” to include legal document support and motion drafting assistance, leveraging a comprehensive U.S. criminal law/constitutional/due-process reference library to help identify potential court/procedural errors and generate draft motions for clients (as part of the platform’s low-cost criminal defense help workflow).
architectural_notes: Payment system must support both online card/wallet processing and offline cash-at-store payments via generated payment code/receipt.

Legal-content feature requires a clearly defined, legally usable content source/licensing approach for statutes/rules/treatises; cannot assume proprietary “all criminal law books” are available by default.
Document/motion generation should be implemented as draft templates/workflow with appropriate disclaimers and human review, not as guaranteed legal outcomes.

existing_features.title: Create the base app/website branded as “Criminal Defence 305” with core informational pages that explain the low-cost criminal defense help services and how the process works.
Implement a case intake/submission flow where users can enter case details and submit them through the platform, then receive an on-screen confirmation with a unique submission ID.
Add a checkout/payment step tied to a case submission that lets users choose a payment method: credit/debit card, PayPal, Cash App, or cash at approved stores.
Support card payments via Stripe checkout (or Stripe payment link flow) as the card-processing method for the app.
For PayPal and Cash App payment methods, provide in-app payment instructions and collect a user-entered payment reference (e.g., transaction ID or username) to associate with the case submission.
Implement cash payments at approved third-party stores by generating a payment code/receipt in the app that the user can present at the store; no in-person payments scheduling.

Add a consistent, coherent visual theme for Criminal Defence 305 (colors, typography, layout) suitable for a serious legal-aid service, and apply it across all pages without using a blue/purple-dominant palette.
Add generated static brand images (logo and simple hero/banner) and render them in the UI from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve via backend).

Implement a backend-managed reference library feature that allows admins to add, update, list, and delete reference entries (text and metadata), and allows authenticated users to search/browse and view reference entries in-app.

Add a guided “Draft Motion” flow that lets a user select a case submission, pick a motion template, fill in required fields, optionally select relevant reference-library entries, and then generates a draft motion document (text output) saved to the backend under that submission.

Add frontend UI to upload and manage legal documents for a submission (metadata + file content stored as text or base64 where feasible), including listing documents, viewing a document, and deleting a document, with clear size/type limits communicated to the user.
Add navigation and routing to expose the new features: Reference Library, Submission Documents, and Draft Motions, without breaking existing case submission and payment flows.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create Criminal Defence 305 app/website with informational pages about low-cost criminal defense help services
Allow users to submit their case details through the platform (case intake/submission)
Support online payments via credit/debit card, PayPal, and Cash App during checkout for services/case submission
Enable cash payments at approved third-party stores by generating a payment code/receipt users can present to pay (no in-person payments)
Add a U.S. criminal law / constitutional / due-process reference library and generate draft motions/documents based on potential court/procedural errors tied to a submitted case

Add backend data models and actor methods to store and retrieve (a) user-uploaded legal documents tied to a case submission and (b) generated draft motion documents tied to a case submission, with ownership checks (user can only access their own items; admin can access all).
